type.name: section
type.title: Mines officers and district mines officers.  PART II RIGHT TO AND GUARDIANSHIP OF MINERALS
type.context: MINING ACT under Mines officers and district mines officers.  PART II RIGHT TO AND GUARDIANSHIP OF MINERALS  5. (1) The Minister may by notice published in the Gazette, designate, for the purposes of this Act or any provision thereof, a public officer or any other person employed by the Government or any employee of the Commission as a mines officer and any such notice shall specify the area for which, and for the purposes of which provisions of this Act, the mines officer is appointed.  (2) The  Minister  may  by  notice  published  in  the  Gazette designate, for the purposes of this Act, a public officer or any other person employed by the Government or an employee of the Commission as a district mines officer and specify the mining district for which he is so appointed:  Provided that the same person may be appointed as district mines officer for more than one mining district.  (3) A district  mines  officer  shall  have, unless  the Minister otherwise directs by notice published in the Gazette, all the functions conferred by this Act on a mines officer and a district mines officer within the mining district or mining districts for which he is so designated.  (4) There shall be such other officers as may be considered necessary for the purposes of this Act, who shall respectively have and exercise the functions assigned to them by or under this Act or by the Commission or the Minister.   (5) The Commissioner of Geological Surveys and Mines shall, by virtue of his office, be a mines officer and shall have throughout Guyana all the functions conferred by this Act on a mines officer and a district mines officer.
